qas.question: What jobs did the earliest Europeans who mingled with natives hold?
Who started marrying or having unions with native women after settlment increased?
Why did Chesapeake Bay colonists begin to buy slaves?
Who first imported slaves to New York?
Who freed some of the early slaves?
What has a long history in Europe?
Who did native men take as companions?

plausible_answers.text: married or had unions with women of native tribes

qas.question: What did traders and fur trappers do before European settlement increased?
What did colonists import in the 16th century?
Who was sometimes freed by their masters during the later years?

context: <b5_0>Interracial relationships<b5_0/> have had a long history in North America and the United States, beginning with the intermixing of <b6_0>European <a0_0>explorers<b6_0/> and soldiers<a0_0/>, who took native women as companions. After European settlement increased, <a1_0>traders and fur trappers<a1_0/> often <b7_0>married or had unions with women of native tribes<b7_0/>. In the 17th century, faced with <a2_0>a continuing, critical labor shortage<a2_0/>, colonists primarily in the Chesapeake Bay Colony, imported <b8_0>Africans<b8_0/> as laborers, sometimes as indentured servants and, increasingly, as slaves. African slaves were also imported into New York and other northern ports by <a3_0>the Dutch<a3_0/> and later English. Some <b9_0>African slaves<b9_0/> were freed by <a4_0>their masters<a4_0/> during these early years.
